about: Experienced Professor with a demonstrated history of working in the higher education industry. Skilled in Teaching, Writing, Editing, Public Speaking, Journalism, and Nonprofit Organizations. Strong education professional with a Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) focused in Theology, Philosophy and Religious Studies from Luther Seminary.

position: Writer, Educator and Caring Global Citizen
recommendations: Michael Bemis, MLIS “Carissa is a wonderful instructor. She makes learning fun by employing a great variety of teaching methods, such as short videos, small group work, short but information packed lectures, and so on. She encourages student participation with supportive feedback and constructive criticism. I found Carissa to be extremely knowledgeable about her subject matter, fair minded in assigning grades and overall a very engaging personality. It was a pleasure taking her class in ethics at St. Paul College during spring semester of 2013.”

volunteer_experience.info: Monitor and advises the Robbinsdale City Council on Human Rights issues. Promote awareness and understanding of human rights issues across our community; Increase access to the Commission; Strengthen the Commission's relationship with the City administration; and Increase the Commission's capacity to promote awareness and understanding of human rights issues.
